sections.content: This photograph captures the **French Renaissance/Neo-Baroque style** of the main palace building, built as the summer residence for the Bulgarian monarchs (late 19th century). It emphasizes the **grandeur and historical importance** of the complex, which is a major cultural monument.

This photo highlights the **80-hectare historical park**, showcasing the variety of flora. The park features French and English gardens with over 500 flower species and rare trees, including the Himalayan Cedar.
This photo likely captures a secondary building, a decorative structure, or a specific angle of the palace, emphasizing the detailed classical architecture prevalent throughout the complex.

photos.title: Evksinograd Interior or Detail
photos.alt: [Interior or architectural detail shot from the Evksinograd complex.]

sections.content: This photo represents the **detailed, ornate furnishings and decorations** of the palace, featuring elements like stylish English furniture, authentic marble fireplaces, and golden silk wallpapers.

A classic view of the palace, reinforcing its role as the **former royal summer residence**. It serves as a reminder of the historical significance, including the signing of the Decree on the Unification of Bulgaria with Eastern Rumelia here in 1885.
This image highlights the **scale and organized paths** of the large, historical park. It shows the deliberate design of the grounds, intended to be explored on foot.
This photograph captures the **coastal element** of the complex. Evksinograd has a 3-kilometer coastline with four well-maintained beaches.
This photo showcases the **formal alignment of the French Garden** area, leading up to the palace. This intentional design creates a sense of scale and royal grandeur.

photos.title: Evksinograd Interior Decor Detail
photos.alt: [Close-up of a detailed interior architectural feature or furniture in Evksinograd Palace.]

sections.content: This image represents the **opulence and high quality of the palace interiors**, featuring rich mahogany and walnut furniture, French chandeliers, and gold-inlaid clocks.

photos.title: Evksinograd Palace Gardens
photos.alt: [Image capturing a section of the Evksinograd Palace gardens with structured planting.]

sections.content: This photo showcases the detail and variety of the botanical collection and the way the garden spaces are formally structured around the palace.
A wide shot illustrating the **grand scale** of the royal residence and its integration with the surrounding parkland and Black Sea setting.
This image captures the deliberate blend of human-made classical structures and natural, lush vegetationâ€”the essence of the park's English and French landscape design.

gallery_description.heading: Evksinograd: The Royal Retreat of the Black Sea
gallery_description.content: Evksinograd (formerly Sandrovo) is the **19th-century summer residence of the Bulgarian monarchs**, located 8 km north of Varna and near St. Constantine and Helena. The complex is a striking example of **French Renaissance/Neo-Baroque architecture**  and is surrounded by an **80-hectare, world-class botanical park**.

gallery_description.heading: Access, Booking, and Requirements
gallery_description.content: Access to the palace and park is **strictly by guided tour only**, due to its status as an official governmental protocol residence. **Advance reservation is mandatory** and must typically be made via email (e.g., *euxinograde@government.bg*) several days in advance. Tours are limited (often **3 per day**) and can be cancelled due to government events.

gallery_description.heading: The Guided Tour Experience
gallery_description.content: The tour typically lasts **1.5 hours** and covers the opulent **First Floor** of the palace, the historical greenhouses, the Chapel of St. Dimitar, and the extensive grounds, including the winery (wine tasting available). **Photography is prohibited inside the palace** but allowed in the park. Comfortable shoes are highly recommended.

gallery_description.heading: Unique Features and Facilities
gallery_description.content: The park is famous for its **rare botanical species** (over 50,000 trees), formal **French and English garden styles**, and historical artifacts like the sundial gifted by Queen Victoria. The complex also features an on-site **Winery** and has sports facilities and limited accommodation (generally for official guests).

gallery_description.heading: Coastal Status and Practical Tips
gallery_description.content: While Evksinograd features four small beaches, **public access to the coastline is generally restricted** to official guests staying at the residence's accommodation. The site is easily reached by car (parking available) or **Varna public bus** (lines 9, 31a, 209b, 409). Tickets are affordably priced (Adults approx. **5 BGN**).
